user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mhd_panic_std:
```c
_MHD_NORETURN static void
mhd_panic_std (void *cls,
               const char *file,
               unsigned int line,
               const char *reason)
{
  (void) cls; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
  fprintf (stderr,
           _ ("Fatal error in GNU libmicrohttpd %s:%u: %s\n"),
           file,
           line,
           reason);
#else  /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */
  (void) file;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) line;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) reason; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif
  abort ();
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function mhd_panic_std:
#define _MHD_NORETURN _Noreturn
...
#define HAVE_MESSAGES 1
...
#define _(String) (String)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
#else  /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */
  (void) file;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) line;   /* Mute compiler warning. */
  (void) reason; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif
explanation: The only potentially unreachable source fragment is the #else block guarded by !HAVE_MESSAGES: in the provided project HAVE_MESSAGES is defined as 1, so that #else branch will never be compiled into the build and is effectively dead for this configuration. Other parts of the function need not be investigated for Rule 2.1: the fprintf branch (the #ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES branch) is active and reachable; the (void) cls; statement is executed before the diagnostic and is not unreachable; abort() is the intended non-returning call and there are no statements after it in this function that would be unreachable. The function's _Noreturn specifier and the call to abort() are consistent and do not on their own indicate unreachable code within this fragment.
